events.name: #1 GDG LA Android Meetup
events.description:
Our first GDG LA Android meet up will happen on July 10th!

Here's everything you need to know:

The event will start at 6:30 pm at Tinder HQ2 offices (8800 Sunset Boulevard, West Hollywood - 3rd floor).

Parking will be provided by our host for free in the same building as where the event will be hosted, entrance is through Palm Ave.

Here's the Agenda:

6:15 pm - Attendees arrive and Networking.
6:45 pm - Engineering in the Atmospheres: How to Build and Maintain Rocket Ships Mid-Flight - Andy Lawton - Tinder
7:30 pm - Break - Food and more Networking
7:45 - 2nd Talk - Building for the Future at Snap - Ben Dodson - Snap

We're excited to kick off this new community and build a strong Android meet up in Los Angeles. Let your friends know.

----
Sponsors:

We'd like to thank Tinder for hosting and sponsoring our first event. We will have drinks and food provided at the Venue.

----
Speakers:

Andy Lawton - Tinder

Andy began his career at Tinder as the Head of Android, leading the team through such projects as Tinder Gold, Boost and an entire rewrite of the iconic Card Stack. He is currently working on Tinder's Gen Z team.

About his talk:

Engineering in the Atmospheres: How to Build and Maintain Rocket Ships Mid-Flight

So your product manager or CEO just finished reading Blitzscaling and now wants you to ship that new feature set even faster! Whether you are building for your first user or already maintaining an app that has thousands, hundreds of thousands or even millions of usersâ€”how do you keep working on a rocket ship that is mid-flight? We will discover the different engineering strategies that have helped Tinder go from start-up to company with strong product-market fit to being the #1 grossing app (non-game) in the world!

-

Ben Dodson - Snap Inc

Ben is an engineer on Snap's Client Platform team, focusing on high-performance frameworks for UI, database, networking, and more. He loves his kids, cats, Mountain View, and Systrace. Before Snap, Ben co-founded Omlet Inc, creator of the Omlet Arcade, a mobile network for gamers.

About his talk:

Building for the Future at Snap

At Snapchat, we recently rolled out a complete rewrite of our Android application. In this talk, we'll cover some of the reasons we embarked on this journey, key design decisions of our new architecture, and the migration strategy we used to move over tens of millions of daily-active users from one million-line codebase to another. Was it worth it? Come find out!
events.how_to_find_us: When you arrive, sign the NDA at the entrance and mention you're there for the GDG LA Android Meetup. Someone will let you in and take the elevator to the 3rd floor.

events.name: #2 GDG LA Android October Meetup
events.description:
SAVE THE DATE!
Our second GDG LA Android meet up will happen on October 30th!

Here's everything you need to know:

The event will start at 6:30 pm at Appetize offices (6601 Center Dr W, Suite 700, Los Angeles).

Food and Drinks will be provided by our hosts! Appetize is providing us with a Lyft code that will get you to and from the event! Your destination or departure must be the Appetize office for the code to work. The code will be emailed to the list of final attendees the day of the event.

AGENDA
6:30 Doors open
7:00 Aaron Weaver: Reactive Content with Jetpack Compose
Jetpack Compose is the latest in a long line of tools that have been encouraging more and more reactive style programming on Android. With the new release of Compose announced at Android Dev Summit, we will discuss what this latest UI tool from Google is, how to use it, and how it fits in with the rest of the modern Android toolkit.
7:30 Android Dev Summit Recap Panel
Last week was Android Dev Summit, hosted by Google in Sunnyvale, CA. Several organizers and co-workers were in attendance, and now it's your turn to ask us your burning questions about the event! Submit your questions here: https://forms.gle/9VEwJPA8PAzxkg728 or ask us live!

SPEAKERS
Aaron Weaver is an Android Engineer at Tinder, and has been working on mobile applications for the better part of 4 years. He is currently trying to understand the magic of Coroutines and Jetpack Compose.

Panelists: Bret and Marcus are Android engineers at Tinder. James and Siena are Android engineers at Appetize.
Moderator: Dave is a Director of Engineering at Appetize

Would you like to speak at a future event? Submit a talk at our CFP over here! https://forms.gle/jegQtXuT5QZFkpH16

IF YOU'RE BRINGING GUESTS, PLEASE MAKE SURE THEY RSVP IN THE EVENT. RSVPs will close at noon the day of the event.

PARKING
If you will be driving yourself, the best place to park is at the Promenade at Howard Hughes Center. The entrance to the parking garage is on Park Terrace. From Sepulveda, turn onto Center Drive, continue to the first traffic light and take a left. You will see a large HHLA sign over the garage. Google Maps will want you to take a U-turn at Park Terrace, but don't do it!

The first 30 minutes are free, then 1 hour of parking is $2, and 4 hours of parking is $3. This is a much cheaper option that the two visitor parking garages located closer to the Appetize office at 6601 Center Dr W, which are $2 for each 15 minutes.

Participants and sponsors are expected to adhere to our Code of Conduct (CoC), which can be found here: https://tinyurl.com/gdglaandroid-coc

group_profile.intro: Marcos is a Senior Android Engineer at Tinder. He carries in his career big projects in Canada for companies like Bell, TransitApp and Shopify. Marcos is also a Google Expert for Android and has given many talks in big conferences around the world.

organizers.name: Bret E.
organizers.bio:
Senior Android Developer @ Tinder

Years of experience building Android apps with a passion for software craftsmanship.
